availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Norvell (Carlisle, Kentucky, judge and attorney)

body.p: Carlisle, Kentucky, judge and attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Emily G. Summers Norvell in Nicholas County, Kentucky on March 15, 1836. Father of Lucy, Joseph, John, Jenny, Alice, and Mattie Norvell. Member of the Kentucky legislature from Nicholas County in from 1833 to 1834. Attorney in Nicholas County in 1850. Attorney and judge in Carlisle in 1860.

ab.bibl:
The Biographical Encyclopaedia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J.M. Armstrong & Company, 1878), 778.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, Town of Carlisle, District 1, p. 4.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film #000252402
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas, District 2, p. 391A.
